statements.name: PROC COMPARE
statements.description: Compares the contents of two SAS data sets, selected variables in different data sets, or variables within the same data set.

arguments.name: ALLOBS
arguments.description: includes the values for all matching observations.

arguments.name: ALLSTATS
arguments.description: prints a table of summary statistics for all pairs of matching variables.

arguments.name: ALLVARS
arguments.description: includes in the report the values and differences for all matching variables.

arguments.name: BASE=
arguments.description: specifies the data set to use as the base data set.

arguments.name: BRIEFSUMMARY
arguments.description: prints only a short comparison summary.

arguments.name: COMPARE=
arguments.description: specifies the data set to use as the comparison data set.

arguments.name: CRITERION=
arguments.description: specifies the criterion for judging the equality of numeric values.

arguments.name: ERROR
arguments.description: displays an error message in the SAS log when differences are found.

arguments.name: FUZZ=
arguments.description: changes the report for numbers between 0 and 1.

arguments.name: LISTALL
arguments.description: lists all variables and observations that are found in only one data set.

arguments.name: LISTBASE
arguments.description: lists all variables and observations found only in the base data set.

arguments.name: LISTBASEOBS
arguments.description: lists all observations found only in the base data set.

arguments.name: LISTBASEVAR
arguments.description: lists all variables found in only the base data set.

arguments.name: LISTCOMP
arguments.description: lists all variables and observations found only in the comparison data set.

arguments.name: LISTCOMPOBS
arguments.description: lists all observations found only in the comparison data set.

arguments.name: LISTCOMPVAR
arguments.description: lists all variables found only in the comparison data set.

arguments.name: LISTEQUALVAR
arguments.description: lists variables whose values are judged equal.

arguments.name: LISTOBS
arguments.description: lists all observations found in only one data set.

arguments.name: LISTVAR
arguments.description: list all variables found in only one data set.

arguments.name: MAXPRINT=
arguments.description: restricts the number of differences to be printed.

arguments.name: total
arguments.description: is the maximum total number of differences to be printed. The default value is 500 unless you use the ALLOBS option (or both the ALLVAR and TRANSPOSE options). In that case, the default is 32000.

arguments.name: per-variable
arguments.description: is the maximum number of differences to be printed for each variable within a BY group. The default value is 50 unless you use the ALLOBS option (or both the ALLVAR and TRANSPOSE options). In that case, the default is 1000.

arguments.name: METHOD=
arguments.description: specifies the method for judging the equality of numeric values.

arguments.name: NODATE
arguments.description: suppresses the printing of creation and last-modified dates.

arguments.name: NOMISSBASE
arguments.description: judges a missing value in the base data set equal to any value.

arguments.name: NOMISSCOMP
arguments.description: judges a missing value in the comparison data set equal to any value.

arguments.name: NOMISSING
arguments.description: judges missing values in both the base and comparison data sets equal to any value.

arguments.name: NOPRINT
arguments.description: suppresses all printed output.

arguments.name: NOSUMMARY
arguments.description: suppresses the data set, variable, observation, and values comparison summary reports.

arguments.name: NOTE
arguments.description: displays notes in the SAS log that describe the results of the comparison.

arguments.name: NOVALUES
arguments.description: suppresses the report of the value comparison results.

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: creates an output data set.

arguments.name: OUTALL
arguments.description: writes an observation for each observation in the BASE= and COMPARE= data sets.

arguments.name: OUTBASE
arguments.description: writes an observation for each observation in the base data set.

arguments.name: OUTCOMP
arguments.description: writes an observation for each observation in the comparison data set

arguments.name: OUTDIF
arguments.description: writes an observation to the output data set for each pair of matching observations.

arguments.name: OUTNOEQUAL
arguments.description: suppresses the writing of observations when all values are equal.

arguments.name: OUTPERCENT
arguments.description: writes an observation to the output data set for each pair of matching observations.

arguments.name: OUTSTATS=
arguments.description: writes summary statistics for all pairs of matching variables to the specified SAS-data-set.

arguments.name: PRINTALL
arguments.description: produces a complete listing of values and differences.

arguments.name: STATS
arguments.description: prints a table of summary statistics for all pairs of matching numeric variables that are judged unequal.

arguments.name: TRANSPOSE
arguments.description: prints the reports of value differences by observation instead of by variable.

arguments.name: WARNING
arguments.description: displays a warning message in the SAS log when differences are found.

statements.name: ATTRIB
statements.description: Associates a format, informat, label, and length with one or more variables.

arguments.name: variable-list
arguments.description: names the variables that you want to associate with the attributes.

arguments.name: FORMAT=
arguments.description: associates a format with variables in variable-list.

arguments.name: INFORMAT=
arguments.description: associates an informat with variables in variable-list.

arguments.name: LABEL=
arguments.description: associates a label with variables in variable-list.

arguments.name: LENGTH=
arguments.description: specifies the length of variables in variable-list.

arguments.name: TRANSCODE=
arguments.description: specifies whether character variables can be transcoded. Use TRANSCODE=NO to suppress transcoding. Variables with TRANSCODE=NO are not returned.

statements.name: BY
statements.description: Orders the output according to the BY groups.

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: specifies the variable that the procedure uses to form BY groups. You can specify more than one variable. If you do not use the NOTSORTED option in the BY statement, then either the observations in the data set must be sorted by all the variables that you specify, or they must be indexed appropriately. Variables in a BY statement are called BY variables.

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: specifies that the observations are sorted in descending order by the variable that immediately follows the word DESCENDING in the BY statement.

arguments.name: NOTSORTED
arguments.description: specifies that observations are not necessarily sorted in alphabetic or numeric order. The observations are grouped in another way (for example, chronological order).

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: names one or more variables for SAS to associate with a format. You must specify at least one variable.

arguments.name: format
arguments.description: specifies the format that is listed for writing the values of the variables.

statements.name: ID
statements.description: Lists variables to use to match observations.

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: specifies the variable that the procedure uses to match observations. You can specify more than one variable, but the data set must be sorted by the variable or variables that you specify. These variables are ID variables. ID variables also identify observations on the printed reports and in the output data set.

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: specifies that the data set is sorted in descending order by the variable that immediately follows the word DESCENDING in the ID statement.

arguments.name: NOTSORTED
arguments.description: specifies that observations are not necessarily sorted in alphabetic or numeric order. The data are grouped in another way (for example, chronological order).

arguments.name: text-string
arguments.description: specifies a label of up to 256 bytes.
removes a label from a variable. Enclose a single blank space in quotation marks to remove an existing label. You can remove labels from multiple variables in a single LABEL statement:

statements.name: VAR
statements.description: Restricts the comparison of the values of variables to the ones named in the VAR statement.

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: one or more variables that appear in the BASE= and COMPARE= data sets or only in the BASE= data set.

statements.name: WHERE
statements.description: Subsets the input data set by specifying certain conditions that each observation must meet before it is available for processing.

arguments.name: where-expression
arguments.description: is an arithmetic or logical expression that generally consists of a sequence of operands and operators.

arguments.name: logical-operator
arguments.description: can be AND, AND NOT, OR, or OR NOT.

statements.name: WITH
statements.description: Compares variables in the base data set with variables that have different names in the comparison data set, and compares different variables that are in the same data set.

arguments.name: variable(s)
arguments.description: one or more variables to compare with variables in the VAR statement.
